alert.note: Alert for Claiborne (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 3:18PM CDT until March 30 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MADISON PARISH...WARREN...CLAIBORNE...HINDS AND NORTHWESTERN COPIAH COUNTIES... At 318 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Vicksburg to near Port Gibson, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Vicksburg, Raymond, Port Gibson, Edwards, Utica, Bolton, Dry Grove, Bovina, Rocky Springs, Brownsville, Le Tourneau, Hermanville, Flowers, Yokena, Reganton, Youngton, Newman, Oak Ridge, Carpenter and Delta. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern Louisiana...and central, southwestern and west central Mississippi. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
